alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 23 at 6:10AM PST until February 24 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero this morning and Friday morning. * WHERE...Disautel Pass, Okanogan, Oroville, Omak, Tonasket, Nespelem, Bridgeport, and Brewster. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Breezy northerly winds with gusts up to 30 mph will continue through this afternoon.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
